runs.comm: On a length, just outside off. The ball moves away too and he lets that one go
Strays on the pads that time and he times the click well, going almost all the way to the square leg boundary, before a diving effort cuts it off at three
Solid forward defensive to that length ball on off
A little shorter on middle and he moves back to tuck it off his hips into the midwicket region
Strays again. Far too wide down leg and swinging away for the batsman to get anything on it
Gets back outside off and the batsman lets this length ball go
Oh, a little inside edge there. This time the ball hints back in just a bit and Sibanda's intended punch through the off side goes down to fine leg
And its a yorker first up. Just outside off and Masakadza gets on his knees and digs it out and scampers a single
On a length, targeting the stumps and he moves back to tuck it away fine on the leg side
Seam and bounce from Irfan. This one's outside off and the batsman pulls his bat well over his head and watches it go to the keeper
Good solid cut shot, just short and wide enough for him get enough timing and Umar Amin's chase is in vain
Full toss, on the pads and Masakadza flicks it off his pads, if looking a little ungainly, but gets full value for it as the ball races off to the midwicket boundary
Oh, there's some improvisation. He plants his front foot outside off and heaves that length ball outside off towards the square leg region

A slower ball there, dupes the batsman as he doesn't time it at all as it goes back to the bowler. But there's an appeal here. Tanvir thinks he's put a boot to the ball that rolled onto the stumps with the non-striker out of his crease. But there's nothing there.
Bouncer. Big tall fast bowler response from Tanvir and the batsman ducks under it
Oh, well saved. Short and wide, asking to be put away. The batsman pulls out the cut but Ahmed Shehzad at point, leaps full length up up to his left and saves a certain four
Goes back and looks to guide this length ball to third man, but doesn't get anything on it.
Shortish and angled into the pads, Sibanda looks to tuck it away behind square but doesn't get anything on it
Great strike. Comes down the track, makes a little room and slams this good length ball one through the covers. Nobody moves
Shortish again and he stays back and punches it to cover.
Intent shown here by the Zimbabwe batsman. This one is short too and he pulls it, but there's no timing on it. Reaches as far the man at midwicket
Lovely timing. Anwar's struggling here. This one was angled into the pads and Masakadza picks this one off his pads off to the midwicket fence.
Play and miss. Better here from Ali. Back outside off and the batsman's beaten while going for a dab to third man
Bounce. Digs it in outside off and he beats the intended cut shot very easily.
This time Sibanda uses Irfan's pace and guides this shortish ball outside off to third man and scampers back for the second as well. Good running
Short and wide again, and the batsman tries to sway outside the line of the ball and slam it over point, misses it completely
Oh, that one bounces too much even for the keeper to collect. Dug in and directed just outside off. The batsman sways away and it kicks off the pitch, beats the keeper and goes all the way
uses the pace and steers this one, shortish and outside off, to third man
Good flight and gets a hint of turn. He moves back and hits it to midwicket
Holds this one back just a bit and Masakdza hits it calmly to mid-on
On off stump, drawing the batsman forward into a denfesive stroke
Flighted outside off and he defends it to cover

a little more flight, but he's got the angle wrong. The batsman moves back to dab it down to fine leg, but the turn beats him and the keeper and fine leg as well. There's the release. Five runs without no fuss
goes back and tucks it around behind square on the leg side
full and on the stumps, and he comes forward and clips it into the leg side
Short and rising, the batsman rides the bounce and opens the face to hit it to point

Well played. Vusi likes Irfan's pace. Irfan continues going short and the batsman sways his torso away from the line of the ball and dabs it backward of point and times it well enough to beat deep third man
This one's a little closer to the body and the back foot punch is not timed. Goes harmlessly into the off side
Fuller this time and he beats the bat. Sibanda is drawn into the drive and there is just enough movement to beat his outside edge
targets the body. Just a little shortish which gets the batsman in a tangle, but he manages to turn it to midwicket and sneak a single
fullish and on the stumps, defended safely
and he gets a gift. Zimbabwe reach 50 with a full blooded cut to a ball that was short, wide and asking to be hit.
Better length here. Full and on middle, forces the batsman to play a defensive stroke
Angles in, Sibanda hangs back and flicks it toward fine leg
wicket-to-wicket bowling from Anwar Ali. Masakadza can't do much more than hit this one straight to mid-on

He's gone. Misjudges the length and he's plumb in front. Reward for keeping things simple for Anwar Ali. Keeps the ball fullish, and Masakadza goes for the pull. It was nowhere near short enough for that shot and the ball sneaks under his bat and hits him right in line of middle
fullish and on the stumps. Taylor hits it into the midwicket region
full on the stumps and the batsman pulls out the forward defensive
A little shorter, allowing the batsman to go back and clip it to fine leg
quicker and flatter, Sibanda moves back and punches it to cover
moves forward and hits it down the ground to long-off
a little more flight from Afridi and the batsman comes forward and drives it to long-off past a diving Afridi
length ball, just outside off and Masakadza commits to a solid forward defensive
slower ball, just a little shorter that allows the batsman to move back and pull it down to fine leg where a good diving effort from Mohammad Irfan stops the ball from going to the boundary

A bit of confusion there. Taylor stays back in his crease, gets behind the line and defends it, but Masakadza has set off for a single. No one gets to the ball quick enough and he reaches his ground safely

Lovely save down a third man. Ali goes short again and Taylor uses all his height to upper cut it over point, and to the left of third man. It was looking to be a one bounce four when the fielder leaps into the air and pushes it back into play
gets back to a fuller length and this one goes down to long-on
shortish and outside off, Taylor opens the face and guides this to the short third man
fuller and angled in, Sibanda stays back and nudges it into the midwicket region
sweep shot. Well timed, Fetches the length ball from outside off and hits it powerfully just behind square
full and right on the stumps. Taylor presents a dead bat
lovely drive from Taylor, goes right forward, leans into this and hits it down to long-off
Oh, that was tight. Quicker ball and the batsman goes back to cut but it hurries on to him and he gets his bat down just in time
And he meets the new bowler with a reverse sweep, but to no avail. Doesn't hit the ball
full, flighted on middle and its hit down to long-on
flighted, but the angle is way down leg. Sibanda lets it go
This time the reverse sweep connects and it races away to the third man boundary.
comes well forward to push it down to long-on for a single
Quicker and flatter and he hits it off to midwicket
Afridi knocks back the leg stump. Sibanda goes back to try and pick a flat, quick ball into the leg side, but he is too slow and the ball cannons into the stumps. Zimbabwe two down
beats his bat. Shortish ball, angled across. Williams moves back to punch it into the off side, but the ball goes past his outside edge
He gets enough bat on this. Powerful shot. Shorter this time and he has ample time to slap that through the covers off the back foot
pulls out the sweep, connects well but its cut off by deep square leg
full and on off stump, Williams turns it down to deep midwicket
full and on off, Williams tries the reverse sweep this time, but can't connect
angling down leg and he moves back to clip it behind square leg
he's tried the reverse sweep one too many times. Hafeez raps him on the pads with a good length ball on middle and the umpire raises the finger
flighted and just outside off. the batsman moves back to defend it but it catches the outside ege
comes forward and turns it into midwicket
fuller and with a little more flight, Taylor moves forward and hits it to wide long-on
and there's turn straight away. The full flighted ball beats Taylor's sweep, and the keeper as well
Maruma pulls out an awkward looking sweep to a ball well wide of off stump. He lookes a little bewildered as the ball wanders off to mid-on
this time the sweep gets him out of jail as he sneaks a single as the ball goes away square on the leg side
More sweeping from Zimbabwe, it seems they've forgotten all the other shots in the book. Too much turn and the Umpire gets some exercise
uses the little bit of width to dab it down to third man
length ball on off gets the reverse sweep again and again it is to no avail.
finally, a straight bat shot. Maruma skips down the track and hits it back to the bowler
Digs it in short and the ball is a little too quick for Taylor's pull shot to connect
much fuller this time and Taylor pushes it to the covers
loopy slower ball from Tanvir. Maruma plays it with soft hands and Taylor calls through for a single
Tanvir using this angle well. Fires this one at the pads from wide of the crease. Taylor only manages a pad but sneaks a single
a little off target here, the ball going a little too wide of leg stump
good yorker. Bowled from wide of the crease again and Maruma digs it out just in time. Taylor wants the single, and makes it with a dive
clever shot. Tanvir bangs this one in, but Taylor ramps it striaght over the keeper's head for a much needed four
comes down the track, but Ajmal sees him and pulls the length back and Maruma can only hit it back to the bowler
Zimbabwe pledge alligence to the sweep. This one gets the top edge and runs off fine to the third man boundary
quicker and Maruma goes back and punches it down to long-on
and its the reverse sweep now. Third man cuts it to a single
flatter ball again and Maruma remains back in his crease and pushes it back to the bowler
makes a little room to use the shortish one from Ajmal to cut through the covers
wicket straight away. Maruma comes down the track but Afridi sees him and fires it wide. Sarfraz collects it cleanly and breaks the stumps. Easily done by Pakistan
full and fast into the stumps and its met with a forward defensive
slog through midwicket. This one was flighted on the stumps and Chigumbura hoiks it off to cow corner
comes forward and punches it to long-on
this time the slog does not work. Simple straight ball from Afridi and Chigumbura's almighty swing is useless as he looks back to see his stumps pegged back
flighted outside off and Taylor slog sweeps it down to square leg
just a little shorter this time and Waller makes room for himself and cuts it to the covers
flighted on the off stump and Taylor clips it into the leg side
comes across and covers his stumps, but his cross bat heave to this length ball only gets air
the reverse sweep works. Waller hits this well above the short third man fielder and gets good reward
and this one's even better. Waller goes down on one knee and lofts this full ball on middle is well over the long-on fence
Angles it into the pads, and Taylor clips it off to midwicket
fullish ball, dabbed behind square on the off side
right in the block hole. Taylor stays leg side of it and tries to spear it through extra cover, but finds the fielder
uses the angle and works it to deep midwicket
Deceived by pace. Taylor was into the pull shot too quickly and this short ball angled at the batsman hits him on the stomach.
Full and on off. Taylor drives it to cover and scampers off for a single. The fielder hits the stumps, but its all over. Pakistan win
